title: Pork Chops with Calvados Apples
description: Pan-seared pork chops finished with a silky pan sauce of browned butter, Calvados apple brandy, and caramelized apples. The dish balances savory pork with bright apple-accented sweetness and a hint of mustard and thyme for a classic French-inspired weeknight or dinner-party entree.

ingredients.display_name: bone-in pork chops, about 1 to 1 1/4-inch thick
ingredients.notes: trim excess fat, bring to room temperature

ingredients.display_name: large apple (e.g., honeycrisp or gala), cored and sliced 1/2-inch thick
Calvados apple brandy (or apple brandy / applejack)
ingredients.notes: can be flamed off in pan or simmered to reduce
plus sprigs for searing if desired

steps.text: Pat pork chops dry and season both sides with half the salt and pepper; if using, lightly dredge in flour and shake off excess. Let rest at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Heat a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat until hot, add olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter; when foam subsides, add pork chops and sear 3–4 minutes without moving until golden-brown.

Flip chops and add a sprig of thyme if using; sear second side 3–4 minutes until golden and an instant-read thermometer reads 140–145°F (60–63°C) for medium. Transfer chops to a warm plate and tent loosely with foil to rest.
Reduce heat to medium; add remaining butter to the pan. Add shallot and garlic, sauté 30–45 seconds until fragrant but not browned.
Add apple slices and brown sugar to the pan, sauté 3–4 minutes until apples begin to caramelize and soften, stirring to coat in butter and browned bits.

Carefully pour in Calvados to deglaze pan; if desired and safe, tilt pan away from face and ignite briefly to flambé so alcohol cooks off (or simmer 30–45 seconds until aromatic). Scrape up browned bits.
Add warm chicken stock and simmer 2–3 minutes to reduce slightly, then whisk in Dijon mustard and lemon juice. Taste and adjust seasoning with remaining salt and pepper.
Return pork chops to the pan with any resting juices and spoon sauce and apples over them; cook 1–2 minutes to rewarm and finish to target temperature (internal temp ~145°F/63°C).

Remove chops to serving plates; stir cold cubed butter and thyme into sauce off heat to thicken and gloss, then spoon apples and sauce over chops. Garnish with chopped parsley if using and serve immediately.
